snippet: Bulgaria also agreed to an Obama administration request to shut its airspace to Russian transport planes, while Greece had not publicly responded to a similar request.
abstract: Bulgarian government closes its airspace to Russian transport planes, agreeing to appeal from the  Obama administration based on intelligence reports that Russians are creating military base in Latakia, Syria; Greece has not responded to a similar request; apparent Russian military preparations and American attempts to block them have escalated tensions between Russian and the United States.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: Bulgaria also agreed to an Obama administration request to shut its airspace to Russian transport planes, while Greece had not publicly responded to a similar request.

headline.main: U.S. Moves to Block Russian Military Buildup in Syria
headline.print_headline: U.S. Moves to Block Russian Military Buildup in Syria

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
